Title:
Globisporangium lacustre sp. nov. re-identified based on
molecular analysis of isolate MAFF 236903 formerly recognized as Pythium
marsipium
Keywords:
Molecular phylogeny, Non-symptomatic infection, Pond
water, Pythium, Taxonomy
Abstract:
An isolate identified as Globisporangium marsipium,
formerly classified as Pythium marsipium, was obtained from pond water
in Osaka in 1992. According to molecular phylogenetic analyses based on
the internal transcribed spacer region of the ribosomal RNA gene and
mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase subunit 1, the isolate was
re-identified as G. lacustre sp. nov. The morphology, phylogeny, and
pathogenicity of the new species are described here.
